ygData.subject: Re: Staff Question
ygData.msgSnippet: Stick to 2-handed blunts. Your next magic weapon will be a Runed Totem Staff from Rex in Paw. It is a 2-handed weapon that has a damage rating of 9(for 19 max
ygData.messageBody:
Stick to 2-handed blunts. Your next magic weapon will be a Runed Totem Staff
from Rex in Paw. It is a 2-handed weapon that has a damage rating of 9(for
19 max damage per swing) gives +5 mana and +5 health. It can also hit
magical creatures.
Yours,
~Aereuss Ravins of Tarew Marr

-----Original Message-----
From: Ken Lee [mailto:kenlee@...]
Sent: Monday, April 19, 1999 9:19 AM
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Staff Question

From: "Ken Lee" <kenlee@...>

I've been using a 2-handed staff since I got lucky killing
Flippy the gnoll.
Haven't gone back.
Honestly, if I HAVE to go into combat, I wanna do dmg. It's
usually landing
that killing blow
while the stupid thing is running away. Do more damage and
you'll run a lot
less.

Zalbar
14th Wizard
Solusek Ro

Subject: [eq_wizards] Staff Question


>From: Donald Taber <dtaber@...>
>
>As a relatively low level wizard, I have found both a one
handed
>staff and a two handed staff. Which skill should I be
working on
>for when I'm a higher level and can get a magic staff? Are
magic
>staffs mainly 1 handed or 2 handed? Either? Any
suggestions?
>
> Thanks,
>
>
Soren
